source_id: STP1295-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_11th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: uniform corrosion resistance is favored when oxide grains are columnar, rather than equiaxed in shape

source_id: STP1295-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_11th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: lithium-accelerated corrosion of Zircaloys corresponds to the formation of equiaxed grains in the oxide in preference to the usually occurring columnar grains

source_id: STP1295-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_11th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: in-reactor acceleration of corrosion observed in PWRs may be partially due to a lithium enhancement even at the low lithium concentrations used in PWRs

source_id: STP1295-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_11th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: an effect due to hydrogen pickup and accumulation at the metal oxide interface may provide a significant contribution to the in-reactor acceleration of corrosion

source_id: STP1295-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_11th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: the detailed characterization of the effects of irradiation on the microstructure of irradiated Zircaloys has confirmed the loss of iron from second phase particles
property_name: iron content in second phase particles

source_id: STP1295-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_11th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: the correspondence between iron in solution in the matrix, the formation of ⟨c⟩-type dislocations, and the onset of accelerated irradiation induced growth has been verified

source_id: STP1295-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_11th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: low irradiation growth in Zr-Nb-Sn-Fe alloys, also presumably due to suppression of ⟨c⟩ dislocation formation
